alert.note: Alert for Bear Lake and Bear River Valley; Cache Valley, Utah Portion; Northern Wasatch Front; Wasatch Back; Wasatch Mountains I-80 North; Western Uinta Mountains (Utah) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 28 at 11:44PM MDT by NWS Saltlake
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Weber... Cache...east central Box Elder...Rich...northeastern Davis... Morgan...northwestern Summit and western Uinta Counties through 1230 AM MDT... At 1143 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles west of Garden to 11 miles north of Morgan. Movement was east at 45 mph. Wind gusts to 50 mph have been observed with these thunderstorms. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Ogden, Layton, Logan, Evanston, Morgan, Randolph, Laketown, Cache, Kaysville, North Ogden, Smithfield, Hyrum, South Weber, Wellsville, Uintah, Mantua, Woodruff, Benson, Utah State University and Weber State University. This includes the following highways... Interstate 80 in Wyoming between mile markers 1 and 12. Interstate 84 between mile markers 88 and 103, and between mile markers 105 and 112. Interstate 80 in Utah between mile markers 177 and 196. US Route 89 between mile markers 459 and 477. Utah Route 30 between mile markers 118 and 135. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
